title: C-P-3.com
text:
C-P-3.com is the fourth <a href="studio%20album">studio album</a> by the rapper <a href="C-Murder">C-Murder</a>. It was released on October 23, 2001, by <a href="TRU%20Records">TRU Records</a> and <a href="Priority%20Records">Priority Records</a> with production by <a href="Rod%20%28Bass%20Heavy%29%20Tillman">Rod (Bass Heavy) Tillman</a> <a href="Carlos%20Stephens">Carlos Stephens</a> and <a href="Donald%20XL%20Robertson">Donald XL Robertson</a>. It was C-Murder's first album since leaving No Limit Records.
Commercial performance.
"C-P-3.com" was not as successful as C-Murder's previous three albums, only peaking at #45 on the <a href="Billboard%20200">"Billboard" 200</a> and #10 on the <a href="Top%20R%26amp%3BB/Hip-Hop%20Albums">Top R&B/Hip-Hop Albums</a>. "C-P-3.com" has sold over 250,000 copies to date.
Singles.
There were two music videos from the album, "What U Gonna Do" and "I'm Not Just". Both were released in 2002, although the single and radio versions were released in 2001. They were C-Murder's last two music videos before he was arrested in 2002 for allegedly beating and shooting a fan. BET and MTV stopped playing the videos after his arrest.
